             [ch]Cm[/ch]     [ch]Gm7/C[/ch]

                 [ch]Cm[/ch]  [ch]Gm7/C[/ch]

                 [ch]Ab/Bb[/ch]   [ch]Bbm7b5[/ch]  [ch]Bb7[/ch]     [ch]C7[/ch]

[Chorus]

In honor of my Chicago Blackhawks winning their third Stanley Cup in six years last night, I had to learn
this one. This is an adaptation for the acoustic guitar...it is not a transcription of how the song is
performed on the recording, but the chords are correct. As an added bonus, this version should be pretty

content.text:
CAPO 3

strum pattern
verse: Am: strum down twice, pluck 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
       Em: strum down twice (fast)
       C: strum down twice, pluck 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
       First Fmj7/C: pluck 5th string twice, pluk 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
       second Fmj7/C: pluck 5th string twice, do plucking as indicated
       rest: D UD 

chorus: D: pluck 4th string two times, pluck 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
        F#m: pluck 6th string twice, pluck 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
        Bm: pluck 6th string twice, pluck 1st, 2nd and 3rd string
        G, A: D UD
        Second G: pluck 6th string, strum down
        B7/Eb: pluck 3rd string, strum down
        Em, Em/C#, Gm, C#dim, D, C/E, F, G: D UDD
        G6/A: strum down twice
        Dm, G/D: pluck 4th string, 3rd, 2nd, 1st, 2nd, 3rd
        G6/A: strum down twice

[Verse 1]

              [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]
I've paid my dues
             [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]
Time after time
                 [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]
I've done my sentence
                    [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]
But committed no crime
            C      Fmj7/C
And bad mistakes
             C      Fmj7/C     e|--3-1-0
I've made a few

               [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G/B[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]
I've had my share of sand kicked in my face
      [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]
But I've come through
                                            [ch]A[/ch]
(And the beat will go on and on and on and on)

 [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]F#m[/ch]           [ch]Bm[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch]

ROBERTO VECCHIONI - A.R.

Beautiful, simple song, which captures in few, concise lines the essence of the life
of French romantic poet Arthur Rimbaud. Brilliant.

Timing is slightly odd in the verse because each line combines a 6/4 bar (1st chord)
and a 4/4 bar (2nd chord). Chorus is 4/4 throughout.

[ch]G7[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]

      [ch]Gm7[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]A7[/ch]          [ch]Dm[/ch]

        [ch]Db[/ch]       Gm7([ch]C[/ch]) [ch]C7[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]

These are by no means the original or "correct" chords for this song, this is 
simply the way I play this song on my acoustic guitar. I think it sounds pretty 
nice, and, well, pretty. Some of these chords I don't know the name of so I just 
listed them below. Sorry if this is crappy - this is my first tab.

*Cadd9 - x32033
*G     - 320033

Capo 4

     [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Em9[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]Em9[/ch]
I see trees of green, red roses too
[ch]Am7[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]B7[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
I see them bloom, for me and you,
      Cadd9*               [ch]Am7[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] 
And I think to myself, What a  wonderful world.

[Verse 2]
     [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Em9[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]Em9[/ch]
I see skies of blue, and clouds of white,
[ch]Am7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]B7[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]         
The bright blessed day, the dark sacred night,
      Cadd9*           [ch]Am7[/ch]       [ch]D7[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                        
And I think to myself, what a wonderful world

[Bridge]
    [ch]D7[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]

Are also on the faces of people goin' by
      [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]Em9[/ch]        *Cadd9
I see friends shaking hands, saying, "How do you do?"
[ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]Gsus2[/ch]    [ch]Am7[/ch]  *G       [ch]D7[/ch] (let ring)     
They're really saying,  "I   love    you."       I hear

[Verse 3]
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Em9[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]Em9[/ch]

[ch]Am7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]B7[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]

      *Cadd9           [ch]Am7[/ch]       [ch]D7[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]
